Name: Ahamkara Scale
FlavorText: "And that Warlock thought I couldn't do it. Hah!"

Name: Ankh of Sai Mota
FlavorText: //…a rattling shriek, the crunch of bones and the fading echoes of a brave woman's last laugh…//

Name: Blood-Soaked Charm
FlavorText: To carry this charm is to fight for the lost world that fashioned it.

Name: Butterfly Code
FlavorText: "Sensitive dependence between microfunctions," reads the inscription. Cryptarchs disagree on whether its origins are from the Vex or Golden Age Mars.

Name: Coyote's Luck
FlavorText: A relic of the legendary Six Coyotes, the first Hunters to scout the Cosmodrome.

Name: Dredgen Yor's Rose
FlavorText: "In his strong hand the man held a Rose. And his aura burned bright."

Name: Efrideet's Eye
FlavorText: Every time she pulled the trigger, an enemy of the City died.

Name: Filament Hex
FlavorText: A Hive totem woven and bound from filaments of the universe itself.

Name: Fist of Eight Moons
FlavorText: Only in the Ascendant Plane—where a well-defended idea is a reality—do these moons, in this small way, still exist.

Name: Hezen Totem
FlavorText: Can a machine change its ways? Any more or less than a human can?

Name: Jasper Carcanet
FlavorText: I WAS MIDHA, CONSORT OF STARS. I WILL NOT BE FORGOTTEN.

Name: Neural Bezoar
FlavorText: "Don't eat that!" "…Too late."

Name: Pallas Ring
FlavorText: The Queen of the Reef commissioned these rings for each of the survivors of the Siege of Pallas.

Name: Parasitic Optic
FlavorText: "Listen, I don't know how it works—I just know that it works, okay? No, I'm not worried."

Name: Prismatic Heart
FlavorText: "You must learn to tease apart the hues of your own heart." —Parables of the Allspring

Name: Rainbow Blade
FlavorText: The beauty of this sacrificial weapon belies the deadliness of its infinitesimally sharp edge.

Name: The Maraid
FlavorText: The chronicle of Queen Mara Sov of the Awoken, compiled by the Primarchs of the Reef Cryptarchy.

Name: The Pahanin Errata
FlavorText: The collected sayings, quips and observations by the legendary Hunter Pahanin.

Name: Thrallskin Drum
FlavorText: A drum made from the skin of a Hive Thrall. Even when no one is playing it, you can always hear a faint beat.

Name: Thrice-Wrapped Thing
FlavorText: Sure, try and unwrap it. I mean, what could possibly go wrong?

Name: Trinary Star
FlavorText: "We were fools to trust this god-machine, this bringer of death and Darkness."

Name: Two-Sided Coin
FlavorText: A Hunter doesn't leave anything to chance.

Name: Unerring Compass
FlavorText: Its needle always points toward the Traveler.

Name: Wax-Sealed Case
FlavorText: Definitely not made of wax. Probably actually a case, though.

Name: Asharru's Hope
FlavorText: "I know not why we left the Reef, nor why we live so long, nor even why we are called Awoken. But I hope one day to have answers." —Asharru

Name: Claw of Command
FlavorText: On the might of your hand does your authority depend.

Name: Cyclopean Enigma
FlavorText: "More eyes, more problems. That's what I always say."

Name: Echo of Honor
FlavorText: "For he was once of your City, and honored there." —Fractal Scrolls

Name: Firebreak Eternal
FlavorText: A piece of the Fire Victorious, the ever-burning flame of the Titan Firebreak order.

Name: Fortuna Pendant
FlavorText: A necklace made out of the remains of the asteroid destroyed during the Reef Wars.

Name: Horn of Six Wars
FlavorText: How many have died with the blast of this horn ringing in their ears?

Name: Iglatho-Cyu
FlavorText: Drink, if you dare.

Name: Incubation Shell
FlavorText: Cryptarchs still have no idea where Vex come from, or how they came to be.

Name: Intact Warmind Core
FlavorText: Codename: MARTEL. Parent: !REDACTED!. Status: ILIODOR COMPLETE.

Name: Judgment of Mars
FlavorText: Cryptarchs say this orb is our first clue toward the identity of the Cabal commander leading the siege of Mars.

Name: Kabr's Pocket Watch
FlavorText: The tick-tock of this strange watch sometimes feels like a heartbeat.

Name: Radegast's Blade
FlavorText: So long as this sword was whole, the Iron Banner could not be broken.

Name: Saint-14's Ring
FlavorText: Was there ever another Guardian so beloved by the people?" —Paean to Saint-14

Name: Scales of Eao
FlavorText: WE STAND UPON OUR OWN UNENDING DEATHS.

Name: Scroll of Eimin-Tin
FlavorText: You hold in your hands the last record of a long-dead civilization.

Name: Skyburners' Obol
FlavorText: A coin suspected to be part of a Cabal funerary rite.

Name: Sootpearl
FlavorText: These oddly beautiful orbs can sometimes be found sunk into the rot and filth of the Dreadnaught.

Name: Stoneborn Relic
FlavorText: A piece of the City's first Wall, carved into the shape of the sigil of the Titan Stoneborn order.

Name: Sunscorched Lens
FlavorText: "We have mastered the art of shaping and tempering physical Light."

Name: Vell Tarlowe's Vigil
FlavorText: His Light is gone, but his memory remains.

Name: Wei Ning's Cong
FlavorText: This ancient jade artifact has been in the Hive's possession ever since Wei Ning's heroic death.

Name: Wings of Apris-Fol
FlavorText: "To you goes the glory and the honor of battle." —Fractal Scrolls

Name: Yzoz's Pendulum
FlavorText: "First test of the mechanism codenamed Yzoz's Pendulum was...not ideal." —RECORD 360-CHASM-2334

Name: Broken Crown
FlavorText: Eliksni songs still tell of Chelchis, Kell of Stone, who stood before the Maw.

Name: Flamel Crest
FlavorText: Anything can be anything else, if only you will it so.

Name: Hourless Glass
FlavorText: The sand in this seemingly ancient timepiece will not move, no matter which way you turn it.

Name: Leaf of the Bleeding Tree
FlavorText: Eat not of the fruit of this tree.

Name: Light of Moths
FlavorText: In the Hive's ontoformic reality, this glow is the manifestation of bound, dying souls.

Name: Numinous Web
FlavorText: A web spun from the flayed and frozen Light of Guardians lost.

Name: Oddly Colored Cube
FlavorText: Gallida died to bring these cubes back from Venus and I still don't know why." —Despoina Kore

Name: Ring of Living Stone
FlavorText: "In memory of the Deep Stone Crypt, the tower where we were born."

Name: Segoth's Head
FlavorText: "Thought we formed the Banner to fight the Darkness, not ourselves. Just don't bode well, s'all I'm sayin'." —Gheleon

Name: Silent Oracle
FlavorText: "Sometimes I swear I could hear it speaking, but I can never remember. I think it spoke of a name."

Name: Sins of Kharad-Tan
FlavorText: For you are not the first hero—nor even Oryx the first villain—to meet upon this plane.

Name: Sisyphus Project
FlavorText: "Clovis refuses to back down. Meanwhile, the others have taken to calling it 'the Sisyphus Project'…" — laboratory notes found at a Clovis Bray facility

Name: Skorri's Dirge
FlavorText: They say she's apart from the Iron Banner, yet she sings songs of her lost companions.

Name: Specimen Twelve
FlavorText: Running hot with the effort of simulating not one group of scientists, but two hundred and twenty-seven.

Name: Spectral Dust
FlavorText: A sample of the mysterious particulate that protects and hides the Reef from invaders.

Name: Techeun Bangle
FlavorText: An approximation of the glittering augments worn by the Queen of the Awoken's advisors.

Name: Thanatonaut's Lullaby
FlavorText: Makes the passage just that much easier.

Name: The Damned Lute
FlavorText: "Hey nonny nonny, hey nonny nonny, be not blithe nor bonny..."

Name: The Traitor's Die
FlavorText: Every roll of this die is already written into the fabric of Oryx's reality.

Name: Tome of Nothing
FlavorText: The few who have claimed to see words on its seemingly blank pages have subsequently gone mad.

Name: Transcendent Eye
FlavorText: "You are not the seer. Not yet. You are the one who is seen." —Parables of the Allspring

Name: Warp Fragment
FlavorText: This piece of Golden Age technology is covered in particulate originating from beyond our solar system.

Name: Weregilt
FlavorText: Even among the Hive, all death has its cost.

Name: Whispering Sphere
FlavorText: You can't be sure, but you think you've seen Lord Shaxx speaking into a sphere just like this one.

Name: Abyss Defiant
FlavorText: We will not go quietly.

Name: ALR96-40 Overkill
FlavorText: Enough is never enough.

Name: An Answering Chord
FlavorText: Let no challenge lie. Let no question hang. Let no music fade.

Name: Anguish of Drystan
FlavorText: "Hard to starboard! Stand by, weapons. Helm, get us out of here!" —Capt. Drystan Cor, First Fleet

Name: Antipodal Hindsight
FlavorText: Nope. Still don't see it.

Name: AR760 Truth Serum
FlavorText: Lie to me, please.

Name: Arminius-D
FlavorText: Unleash a torrent on your enemies with the Häkke Arminius-D.

Name: Atheon's Epilogue
FlavorText: "Atheon's story is still being written. The wielder holds the pen." - Unknown

Name: Black SUROS ADM-94
FlavorText: A rapid-action Suros firearm, earned through glory in the Crucible.

Name: Black SUROS PPG-96
FlavorText: A high-velocity Suros firearm, earned through glory in the Crucible.

Name: Bronzed Miyamoto-D
FlavorText: An aggressive Häkke auto rifle, earned through glory in the Crucible.

Name: Carte Blanche S.1
FlavorText: An accurized Vanguard-issue auto rifle, designed for performance at long range.

Name: Cassiopeia
FlavorText: A Guardian relic named for the queen of the night sky.

Name: Clean Sweep XI
FlavorText: For housekeeping.

Name: Cydonia-AR2
FlavorText: Full-auto instrument of war. The AR2 is a general-purpose weapon with a robust blowback action.

Name: Cydonia-AR3
FlavorText: The City can't rely on a steady supply of programmable matter, so the multirole AR3 uses it only sparingly.

Name: Deep Fix T76
FlavorText: The word 'multirole' is kind of a misnomer. The role is shooting. Gun's just flexible about the how of it.

Name: Dispatch I11
FlavorText: Sends help with every squeeze.

Name: Do Gooder V
FlavorText: Hey! Hey! I can help!

Name: Doctor Nope
FlavorText: First, do no* harm. *For values of 'no' approaching 'vast and permanent'

Name: Doctrine of Passing
FlavorText: Death is the best teacher.

Name: Doctrine of Passing (Adept)
FlavorText: Death is the best teacher.

Name: Does Not Bow
FlavorText: A Kell cut off his arms. He built himself new ones. Then he killed the Kell with them.

Name: Eclypse V/MX2
FlavorText: If it's worth shooting once, it's worth shooting - how many times was that?

Name: Eidolon Ally
FlavorText: We thought it was inanimate but it has grown...changed. Ghost refuses to analyze it further but I secretly believe it has become my friend.

Name: Fabian Strategy
FlavorText: Wait for enemy to make a mistake. Die. Stand by for Ghost Resurrection. Repeat as necessary.

Name: First Rule DHYB
FlavorText: Patience is a virtue. Bullets are better.

Name: For the People
FlavorText: I stand against the state of nature.

Name: Forcing Function
FlavorText: Psychologically tuned to reinforce an important skill: holding down the trigger.

Name: Frontier-AR1
FlavorText: Clear skies. Tall grass. Open space. Perfect shot.

Name: Galahad-B
FlavorText: Full-auto instrument of war. Precision-fire variant with a harmonic dampening system for accuracy at range.

Name: Galahad-E
FlavorText: This extraordinary multirole rifle boasts a smartmatter frame, the key to remarkable capabilities.

Name: Grim Citizen III
FlavorText: The grief and horror of Twilight Gap drove some of the finest gunsmiths in the City to elevate their art.

Name: Haakon's Hatchet
FlavorText: An auto-fire weapon, forged in fire by the Lords of the Iron Banner.

Name: Häkke Test-A
FlavorText: Häkke prototype. Use against Fallen targets to gather data for Häkke's armament scientists.

Name: Hard Light
FlavorText: Ionized polymer synballistic attack platform. The system's lethality is dynamically robust across tactical spaces.

Name: Harrowed Anguish of Drystan
FlavorText: "Hard to starboard! Stand by, weapons. Helm, get us out of here!" —Capt. Drystan Cor, First Fleet

Name: Her Memory
FlavorText: All things are done in her name.

Name: Her Right Hand
FlavorText: An Awoken gift from the Reef, marked with the Queen's crown.

Name: Her Right Hand
FlavorText: The Royal Guard's weapon of choice.

Name: Her Vengeance
FlavorText: An Awoken gift from the Reef, marked with the Queen's crown.

Name: Hex Caster ARC
FlavorText: The engine of devastation slumbers within - waiting for a worthy finger on the trigger.

Name: Husk of the Pit
FlavorText: Dessicated and nigh-inoperable this Hive artifact still manages to send shivers up your spine when fired.

Name: Izdubar-D
FlavorText: Millennia will pass, and your name will still ring out.

Name: Khvostov 7G-02
FlavorText: An ancient weapon, battered and worn - but it still fires true. Perhaps it's been waiting for you.

Name: Longspée-A
FlavorText: When all around you is chaos, the dependable Häkke Longespée-A won't fail you.

Name: Low Down P-XIV
FlavorText: "It's competition. It's the Crucible way." —Lord Shaxx

Name: Marshal-A
FlavorText: Full-auto instrument of war. Tuned for accurate fire at good range - useful when engaging masses of Fallen.

Name: Marshal-A0
FlavorText: This auto rifle is a reliable fallback when other weapons can't be found.

Name: Marshal-A1
FlavorText: Full-auto instrument of war. Tuned for accurate fire at good range - useful when engaging masses of Fallen.

Name: Monte Carlo
FlavorText: There will always be paths to tread and methods to try. Roll with it.

Name: Morass-AR4
FlavorText: Flooded fields. Rustling reeds. Sodden shelter. Mark your targets.

Name: Necrochasm
FlavorText: Eternity is very close. Can you feel yourself slipping?

Name: Painted SUROS CGB-47
FlavorText: A precise Suros auto rifle, earned through glory in the Crucible.

Name: Paleocontact JPK-43
FlavorText: An auto rifle, modified by Dead Orbit's superb technicians and specialists.

Name: Pest Control Matrix
FlavorText: No infestation. Guaranteed.

Name: Primed SUROS JJJ-76
FlavorText: A fine-tuned Suros firearm, earned through glory in the Crucible.

Name: Problem 78F
FlavorText: Cabal military codes allegedly refer to 'death by multiple gunshots' as 'Problem 78, Subsection F'.

Name: Quagmire-AR1
FlavorText: Soggy conditions. Low visibility. Accuracy? Perfect.

Name: Questing Beast
FlavorText: You'll never catch it. But that's not the point.

Name: Red Spectre
FlavorText: Rumor has it that Red Death prototypes are circulating in the Crucible once again.

Name: Righteous VII
FlavorText: Executor-issued auto rifle for loyal supporters of the New Monarchy.

Name: Rising Tide AR0
FlavorText: Can't stop the inevitable.

Name: Ros Neve IV
FlavorText: Bright as the sea, old as the ocean, fierce as the storm.

Name: Sahara-AR2
FlavorText: Full-auto instrument of war. The Sahara is a rapid-fire weapon built to throw a storm of lead.

Name: Sahara-AR3
FlavorText: The Sahara-AR3 is a storm weapon, built to hail bullets. The action self-corrects to prevent jams.

Name: Sahara-AR5
FlavorText: This extraordinary multirole rifle boasts a smartmatter frame, the key to remarkable capabilities.

Name: Shadow Price
FlavorText: A precision auto rifle left behind by Toland, the Shattered. It asks so little, and it offers so much.

Name: Shingen-C
FlavorText: The Shingen-C is a precision rifle for seasoned Guardians. The barrel floats in smart gel, insulating it from shock.

Name: Shingen-E
FlavorText: The exemplary Shingen-E is built to pop skulls.

Name: Silimar's Wrath
FlavorText: An auto rifle forged in fire by the Lords of the Iron Banner.

Name: Silvered Hushwind-D
FlavorText: A highly accurate Häkke auto rifle, earned through glory in the Crucible.

Name: Soulstealer's Claw
FlavorText: The claws dig deep. The pain is unrelenting.

Name: Steppe-AR3
FlavorText: Arid air. Sharp horizon. Nowhere to hide. Make it count.

Name: SUROS ADM-50
FlavorText: A good weapon to have at your side in a pinch, or when just killing time.

Name: SUROS ARI-41
FlavorText: Balance. Flexibility. Style. SUROS.

Name: SUROS ARI-45
FlavorText: Precision. Power. Style. SUROS.

Name: SUROS ARN-33
FlavorText: Rapid fire. Superior design. SUROS.

Name: SUROS ARN-39
FlavorText: Uncanny precision. Forgives user errors. SUROS.

Name: SUROS PRR-11
FlavorText: The Suros PRR-11 is a balanced, flexible and dependable weapon.

Name: SUROS Regime
FlavorText: Nostalgia as a weapon of war. Style as a hallmark of victory.

Name: SUROS TSA-10
FlavorText: Suros prototype. Make precision kills to gather data for the Suros research department.

Name: SUROS TYR-14
FlavorText: Stable. Dependable. Rapid-fire. SUROS.

Name: SUROS WER-45
FlavorText: Precision. Modulation. Superiority. SUROS.

Name: Surrender A
FlavorText: The advice is meant for them, not you.

Name: The Dealbreaker
FlavorText: Not gonna happen.

Name: The Summoner
FlavorText: Join the dance of fire and birth.

Name: The Summoner (Adept)
FlavorText: An elite trophy earned only by Trials of Osiris champions.

Name: Unwilling Soul-09
FlavorText: An auto rifle modified by Dead Orbit's superb technicians and specialists.

Name: Up For Anything
FlavorText: Risk is its own reward.

Name: Vindicator XI
FlavorText: Executor-issued auto-fire weapon, custom-rigged for loyal supporters of the New Monarchy.

Name: Wolfslayer's Claw
FlavorText: Its claws are sharp, many and unrelenting.

Name: Wolfslayer's Claw II
FlavorText: Its claws are sharp, many and unrelenting.

Name: Zarinaea-D
FlavorText: You provide the will, and the Häkke Zarinaea-D provides the way.

Name: Zhalo Supercell
FlavorText: An upcycled torrent of righteous thunder.

Name: "After Effects"
FlavorText: "Nothing that happens in the Crucible is irreversible…except the lessons you learn."

Name: "Ancestral Demise"
FlavorText: Humanity's rich and tattered history provides fuel for libraries of debate on Light, the Traveler, and all creation.

Name: "Blind Evoke"
FlavorText: "Learning without application is like drinking without thirst." - from Aphorisms To Anger Warlocks, a Hunter handbook

Name: "Blood Maturity"
FlavorText: "I have found that rarest treasure: a pragmatic Warlock." - Saint-14

Name: "Born of Sight"
FlavorText: "Reality is the most ruthless analyst." - Praxic saying

Name: "Circle of War"
FlavorText: "Understanding is not an end, but a beginning from which new truths are born."

Name: "Computable Secrets"
FlavorText: Exo Warlocks take particular interest in the physics of Light, seeing analogy to their own origins.

Name: "Controversial Remains"
FlavorText: Like all Guardians, Warlocks are vessels for the Traveler's Light. But that power must be mastered.

Name: "Cosmic Truths"
FlavorText: "To bind Light into the same framework as the proton or the mere neutrino is an act of close-minded hubris."

Name: "Creation's Wind"
FlavorText: "The Light releases us from causality. It smooths the contours of what we can and cannot do."

Name: "Cryptic and Ineffable"
FlavorText: "You did not receive the bond so you could babble arcane words. Go forth, and burn our enemy."

Name: "Curse of the Hidden"
FlavorText: "I vowed to avenge them all, and this curse I will carry to my final death." - Eriana-3

Name: "Death of Fate"
FlavorText: "Our fate is not sealed. With the proper will, and enough force, it can be rewritten."

Name: "Dispersed Vengeance"
FlavorText: "I made quite a reputation in the Crucible. Spent some time trying to outrun it." - Ikora Rey

Name: "Dread's Enmity"
FlavorText: "They've stolen our worlds. In return, would you not send their ether to the winds? I would. I have."

Name: "Emerald Light"
FlavorText: "They'll believe you are one of their own. And that is the only way." - Toland, the Shattered

Name: "Eternal Light"
FlavorText: "You stand for something immutable and transcendent. Act like it." - reprimand to a younger Ikora Rey

Name: "Existential Threats"
FlavorText: Furious debate divides those that seek knowledge in order to aid the City, and those who seek knowledge for its own sake.

Name: "Expansion"
FlavorText: Always consider the connection between your field work and vaster things.

Name: "Eye of History"
FlavorText: Those orders most closely allied with the Titans seek to hone the battlefield deployment of Light.

Name: "Faceless Demise"
FlavorText: A true leader speaks with the voice of the people.

Name: "Forgotten Force"
FlavorText: Every exercise of your power adds a syllable to the greater song.

Name: "House of Devils"
FlavorText: "What shall we call thee?"

Name: "House of Kings"
FlavorText: "Have they not learned the fate of Earth's kings?"

Name: "House of Wolves"
FlavorText: "Beware of false prophets."

Name: "Immanent War"
FlavorText: "The next war is already here, waged in the theater of the inmost."

Name: "Inertia Engine"
FlavorText: "I believe that the Traveler and its Light are advanced technology. I refuse to accept that this diminishes me."

Name: "Light Beyond"
FlavorText: "Every light that marks the abyss offers hope against the rising tide."

Name: "Light Unknown"
FlavorText: The bond is signified and signifier, source and focus. Do not seek closure. Let the mystery unfold you.

Name: "Loop of Night"
FlavorText: "I could flense you apart, molecule by squirming molecule. It is within my power." - Toland the Shattered

Name: "Metastability Event"
FlavorText: The great energies of the Golden Age never triggered a false vacuum decay. We'll be fine.

Name: "Mirrors of Chaos"
FlavorText: If the City falls, there will be no one left to adjudicate phenomenological debates. So now, even the scholars fight.

Name: "Mystic Drain"
FlavorText: At the desperate battle of Twilight Gap, Warlocks worked in concert to shatter the enemy. It was not quite enough.

Name: "No Footprints"
FlavorText: "Gravity? Oh, that nuisance. I never bother with it." —Lyssa, the Lighthearted

Name: "No Tomorrow"
FlavorText: "For every dead yesterday there waits a new dawn, with no promise of tomorrow."

Name: "One True Constant"
FlavorText: Some orders eschew all metaphysics and ontological doctrine in favor of pure combat discipline.

Name: "Other Side of Nothing"
FlavorText: "Nobody comes back the same."- The Parables of Osiris

Name: "Paradox and Truth"
FlavorText: "The Light remade us. Can I still claim to be human? Can you still say you were made by human hands?"

Name: "Phantom Wisdom"
FlavorText: "What is Light? Who made it? How does it work? Light itself answers these questions. Do you understand?"

Name: "Praxic Thunder"
FlavorText: With knowledge, purpose. Each sharpens and hones the other.

Name: "Praxic Vim"
FlavorText: Praxic Warlocks don't hate research. They just don't let it interfere with the fight.

Name: "Red Eternal"
FlavorText: Death is the fate of all life. We only shorten the way.

Name: "Ritual Expansion"
FlavorText: "Beyond Sol's gravity, beyond Earth's pull." —Arach Jalaal

Name: "Song of Dusk"
FlavorText: "I'll be the last Light they ever see." - Eriana-3

Name: "Song of the Light"
FlavorText: At the edge of the singularity, light freezes, unable to face the mystery. But you must go on.

Name: "The Age to Come"
FlavorText: "There is strength in unity. And a King of many, will be the King of all."

Name: "The Before Time"
FlavorText: "Do you remember who you were?"

Name: "The Calming"
FlavorText: "I have devised a technique to liberate the soul from the flesh. It works very reliably on Fallen."

Name: "The Chaos Constant"
FlavorText: "Darkness consumes, but, we shall mark the abyss with eternal fire."

Name: "The Conflagration"
FlavorText: Everything was born from an unimaginable fire. Here, I'll show you.

Name: "The Cure"
FlavorText: "We have a solution." - Ikora Rey, in an emergency session of the City Consensus

Name: "The Gone"
FlavorText: "He came at me with a knife. I put out my hand and - just so - made him into ash."

Name: "The Order"
FlavorText: "A fractured will is the hallmark of disorder…"

Name: "The Risen Ones"
FlavorText: What rules us is our service to the greater welfare of the City.

Name: "The Tethering"
FlavorText: "The farther apart you pull two quarks, the harder they snap back."

Name: "The Transcendent Mind"
FlavorText: "Other orders try to learn the laws of Light. We accept that Light transcends all law."

Name: "The Unconquerable"
FlavorText: "Let's stop thinking about how to open the lock and start thinking about removing the wall."

Name: "The Waking Dreams"
FlavorText: Awoken Warlocks ponder their own visions as whispers into the truths of Light and Dark.

Name: "Tooth and Claw"
FlavorText: Reality grew from the carcasses of an infinity of might-have-beens.

Name: "Trained Chaos"
FlavorText: "Control space and time. Mere matter and energy will follow."

Name: "Twist of Fate"
FlavorText: "There will come a time when you can no longer see objects - only clouds of probability and law."

Name: "Variable Flow"
FlavorText: "Your power flows through the bond. Remember what it represents."

Name: "Wearable Collider"
FlavorText: Mm, yes, a fine cloak. But I have a supercompressed supercollider on my arm. Can your cloak split quarks?

Name: "Willful Exodus"
FlavorText: "…'til even the stars heed our calling."

Name: "Worm Gods' Boon"
FlavorText: They had a choice. They chose the hunger. They chose the Formless One. They chose the Worm Gods.

Name: Barkhan Dune Bond
FlavorText: "The sandstorm that buries Meridian will unearth Vasconia." —Warlock saying

Name: Binary Lazarus
FlavorText: Encrypted by the First Children at the Precipice of Flame, before the Exile.

Name: Bond of Control
FlavorText: A Warlock's bond signifies control over the Traveler's Light. What 'control' means is a matter of debate.

Name: Bond of Credulity
FlavorText: "They call me unorthodox. I call them boring." —Wen Jie

Name: Bond of Emptying
FlavorText: Peace within. War without.

Name: Bond of Focus
FlavorText: A bond is symbol, instrument, and warning. Light can reveal mysteries. But even a child knows not to stare into the sun.

Name: Bond of Guardians
FlavorText: Bearing the devices of every Guardian class, this escutcheon represents Light united against Darkness.

Name: Bond of Polarity
FlavorText: Some orders believe that Light and Darkness exist beyond the merely material, with a logic of their own.

Name: Bond of Preparation
FlavorText: A Warlock needs nothing but a vigorous mind.

Name: Bond of the Desolate
FlavorText: In honor of the Queen.

Name: Bond of the Exile
FlavorText: "They who entered the Speaker's chambers as master and apprentice were bitter rivals when they left." —Brother Vance

Name: Bond of the Fen
FlavorText: There's nothing out there. So why do we keep going back?

Name: Bond of the Queen's Guard
FlavorText: One throne beneath the howling dark.

Name: Bond of the Tilt
FlavorText: "Don't want to get rusty now, do we?" —Ikora Rey

Name: Bond of the Universal
FlavorText: Some orders argue that Light and Darkness can be explained in the context of supersymmetric physics.

Name: Bond of the Uprooted
FlavorText: Cut away the rot. Let the young trees take root.

Name: Bond of the Wormlore
FlavorText: "They were two once. In the Darkness they joined. Such is the Hive's strength. And such is their hunger." —Eris Morn

Name: Bond of Unknowing
FlavorText: Some orders assert that Light and Darkness are not bound by any system of reason or causality.

Name: Bond of Veils

Name: Captured Solar Remnant

Name: Devils' Bond

Name: Ebonthorn Bond

Name: Fragment of the Prime
FlavorText: Caged in ascendant motes, it still glimmers with the light of some ceaseless calculation.

Name: Haliaetus Bond
FlavorText: "Nowhere to land. Gotta keep flying."

Name: Harlequin Pendulum
FlavorText: A curious device, sought after by the Gensym Scribes.

Name: Heliopause Bond

Name: Incandescent Mind

Name: Infinite Lines Bond
FlavorText: ...pulled the subject from the Device he appeared frozen. No vitals, but the body hasn't rotted either. —RECORD 340-CHASM-NULL

Name: Iron Camelot Bond
FlavorText: Forged in remembrance of Skorri, she who sang out the Iron Song.

Name: Kallipolis Bond

Name: Skorri's Iron Bond

Name: Spektar Bond

Name: Spektar Haliaetus Bond
FlavorText: "Nowhere to land. Gotta keep flying."

Name: Spektar Heliopause Bond
FlavorText: If only Darkness lies beyond the heliopause, we have already lost.

FlavorText: …pulled the subject from the Device he appeared frozen. No vitals, but the body hasn't rotted either. —RECORD 340-CHASM-NULL

FlavorText: You are the calm eye of the dire storm.

Name: Sublime Light Bond

Name: Terra Clasp

Name: The Five Lives of Albios

Name: Timor's Iron Bond

Name: Astrolord Boots
FlavorText: When the last war comes, we will be the victors.

Name: Battuta

Name: Blindsight Legs

Name: Desolate Legs

Name: Cloak of Repair

Name: Cloak of Seven Bones

Name: Cloak of the Apsides
FlavorText: "The Hunter creed calls us outward. And what do we find out there? Hard vacuum. Respect it."

Name: Cloak of the Cosmonaut
FlavorText: Vladimir Komarov helped build and fly Earth's first ships. He gave his life to the frontier.

Name: Cloak of the Dusktorn
FlavorText: "I'll remember the Light. Will it remember me?" - Sai Mota

Name: Cloak of the Exile
FlavorText: "Was he exiled? Did he leave willingly? Was the parting angry? Peaceful? Is he dead? Alive? In a word: yes." —Sister Faora

Name: Cloak of the Exodus
FlavorText: Find the way.

Name: Cloak of the Hidden
FlavorText: "The shadows dance quickly among the dust. Make them your ally." - Eris

Name: Cloak of the Ironsworn
FlavorText: "Those who find victory in the Crucible will win salvation for our City." - Iron Banner maxim

Name: Cloak of the Justicars
FlavorText: In pursuit of the City's safety, our jurisdiction is unlimited.

Name: Cloak of the Leopard
FlavorText: Legend says that no animal was more difficult to hunt than the leopard.

Name: Cloak of the Mantis
FlavorText: "Patient camouflage and precise violence. No wonder they survived."

Name: Cloak of the Pariah
FlavorText: "I wear his symbols proudly in the City, to remind them that Osiris is not truly gone." —Fractal Scrolls

Name: Cloak of the Reefrunners
FlavorText: "The child asked me if the Awoken were blue because they were cold. Then he called my cloak a blanket."

Name: Cloak of the Rising
FlavorText: The New Monarchy is the aegis that guards humanity.

Name: Cloak of the Shadowjacks
FlavorText: Twilight Gap highlighted the desperate need for proactive strikes to keep the enemy off balance.

Name: Cloak of the Shadowsmiths
FlavorText: "It's already being handled." - Cayde-6, in an emergency session of the City Consensus

Name: Cloak of the Sixth Reign
FlavorText: One throne beneath the howling dark.

Name: Cloak of the Skypillar
FlavorText: Some suggest Saint-14's legendary vigil was enabled by a few roaming Hunters and their bloody culls.

Name: Cloak of the Sojourn
FlavorText: The stars are calling.

Name: Cloak of the Unborn
FlavorText: "Child asked me if I was a clock. I told her yes. I was keeping time until the world would be safe for her."

Name: Cloak of the Unfactorable
FlavorText: "Could the Vex build a model of us? A simulated City, a whole simulated Earth, adrift in the ocean of the Vex intellect?"

Name: Cloak of the Unflinching
FlavorText: Anyone who takes the pathway into orbit will never want to leave it. Challenge the universe.

Name: Cloud Walker Tribute
FlavorText: A cloak which bears the emblem of the Cloud Walkers, the pioneers of the first Exodus.

Name: Competitor Match
FlavorText: "Instinct tells you to cherish victory, but defeat holds all the lessons." —Lord Shaxx

Name: Cosmic Joke
FlavorText: An infamous cloak, scavenged off the corpses of its owners numerous times on the frontier.

Name: Cult/Trinary Star
FlavorText: The mark of the Trinary Star, the hidden cult who curse the Traveler's light.

Name: Darkhollow Mantle
FlavorText: "To even exist in their space is to constantly demand your own existence." —Eris Morn

Name: Dead Light Cloak
FlavorText: "Beyond the Reef. Beyond the Nine." —Arach Jalaal

Name: Dead Zone Revolution
FlavorText: With each Dead Zone charted comes a new cloak pattern from the Hunter elite.

Name: Devils' Cloak
FlavorText: "There are some bargains worthy of any risk."

Name: Devils' Disguise
FlavorText: Hide your face.

Name: Drifter's Cloak
FlavorText: Cut from City textile and worn as a mark of pride by Hunters with big dreams.

Name: Dustwalker Cloak
FlavorText: A good survival cape can be used as a hull patch, bandage, tourniquet, pressure seal, picnic blanket...

Name: Dynamo Cloak
FlavorText: "Your missions: protect the City. Look better than Warlocks. But don't look like you're trying." - Pahanin Errata

Name: End Unsung
FlavorText: A humble cloak worn in tribute to the Guardians who met their end alone in the wild.

Name: Extropic Cloak
FlavorText: "Child came for our robes today. He said the Awoken Hunters needed them, as they were cold." —Warlock doorlog

Name: Fieldcraft Hood
FlavorText: Even vacuum-ready field wire armor should be kept out of the rain. Rig a hood.

Name: Fixer Cloak
FlavorText: I solve problems.

Name: Frumious Cloak
FlavorText: Tell the Warlocks your cloak is frabjous. They respect words they don't understand.

Name: Ghost Angel Cloak
FlavorText: We are an army of the chosen dead.

Name: Grinder's Cloak
FlavorText: "First, check your cloak for damage. Second, inspect yourself for major wounds." - Handbook of (Un)Controversial Advice

Name: Gunslinger's Cloak
FlavorText: In the dark days before the Last City, all a Hunter had was the Light and a steady aim.

Name: H_LD Starwinder Cloak
FlavorText: As the cloak frays, it reveals the ancient works of Li Qingzhao, carved in chips of bone.

Name: Harbinger Hood
FlavorText: A pattern inspired by the legendary Awoken weapon.

Name: Hardcase Cloak
FlavorText: If you learn nothing else, learn this: when a Hunter takes up the cloak of a dead comrade, this is a vow.

Name: Heliopause Cloak
FlavorText: "Once, deep space explorers were seen as heroes. Now, for suggesting humanity should look beyond this system, some call us cowards." —Arach Parnell

Name: Highest Squidder
FlavorText: "Are you squidding me?"

Name: Hood of the Night Sun
FlavorText: "I am not a dashing rogue. I am not a free spirit. I am a claw in the throat of the dark, and I will draw blood."

Name: Hood of the Spawn
FlavorText: "Toland cracked the rune, or led us to believe he did. I told him it was either that, or the Hive have a hell of a recipe for beer." - Omar Agah

Name: Hustler's Cloak
FlavorText: They say you will never find an impractical Hunter. But what do 'they' know about dashing cloaks?

Name: Infinite Lines Cloak
FlavorText: ...pulled the subject from the Device he appeared frozen. No vitals, but the body hasn't rotted either. —RECORD 340-CHASM-NULL

Name: Iron Camelot Cloak
FlavorText: Forged in remembrance of Gheleon, he who was a true Guardian to the people.

Name: Journey Hood
FlavorText: It's not the destination that matters.

Name: Kallipolis Mantle
FlavorText: The leader we need is among us, not above us.

Name: Kell's Cloak
FlavorText: "Here's my plan to be Kell. Fallen seem to respect violence and big capes. I'm really violent, and I found this cape."

Name: Kellhunter's Hood
FlavorText: The strongest lead the pack.

Name: Kings' Cloak
FlavorText: "Of which world? All of them."

Name: Kings' Mantle
FlavorText: Fit for royalty.

Name: Lead Scout's Cloak
FlavorText: "To clear mines: step on mine. Wait for Ghost revival. Step on mine 2. Wait for Ghost. Step on - "

Name: Legend of Six Coyotes
FlavorText: A cloak fashioned after the legendary Hunters who first scouted beyond the Cosmodrome wall.

Name: Long Tomorrow 9G
FlavorText: "You didn't tell me this treasure was in the red mists of Murmuring Rock. Count me out."

Name: Makeshift Scarf
FlavorText: The Hunter's cloak speaks to their personality. Your Ghost scrounged up this tough synthetic wrap, marked with an ancient double-headed eagle.

Name: Mantle of Efrideet
FlavorText: Stand in the fire until there is nothing left to burn away.

Name: Mantle of Gheleon
FlavorText: You are an army, an armada, a force unto itself.

Name: Mantle of Perun
FlavorText: Your mark be made, by thunder's crack or lightning's strike.

Name: Mantle of Sublime Light
FlavorText: A trial by fire, the purpose of which is transformation.

Name: Maverick's Cloak
FlavorText: "Bright colors are Mother Nature's way of saying 'don't mess with me.' We like a lot of her ideas."

Name: Melting Point
FlavorText: In the Crucible, you'll find yours.

Name: Nagari Cloak
FlavorText: In this age of Light and fire, simple skills still endure. Hunters embroider signs of war and loss on their cloaks.

Name: Neuroghast Cloak
FlavorText: To control your opponents, you must first control your own body.

Name: Night Rain Cloak
FlavorText: Hunters constantly tweak and upgrade their armor. A cloak is the best mark of recognition.

Name: Nightmask Cloak
FlavorText: "They say the Crucible is preparation for the frontier. I see it the other way around." - Ain Suhu-ässä

Name: Nightstalker Cloak
FlavorText: Live and die by the draw of a bow.

Name: Nightstalker's Cloak
FlavorText: "We are the rangers, the keen-eyed scouts who stalk the Darkness where it dwells."

Name: Not A Fallen Hood
FlavorText: Friendly fire is as deadly as any Fallen skiff, so some Hunters choose cloaks for pure visibility.

Name: Octopus Cloak
FlavorText: "If human extinction seems imminent, try to relax. You're just giving cephalopods a shot." - Pahanin Errata

Name: On the Marsh
FlavorText: Swamp camouflage is the hottest fashion these days.

Name: Ones and Zeroes
FlavorText: Maybe that's all we really are.

Name: Pennant Cloak
FlavorText: Guardians often band together and form close-knit teams to achieve victory in the Crucible.

Name: Pilgrim's Cloak
FlavorText: How many fell on the road to the City? How few made the last leg of the journey with a Ghost over their shoulders?

Name: Pleiades Hood
FlavorText: The enemy sees beyond visual light, so cloth camouflage is difficult. No sense looking drab.

Name: Quantum-Phoenix Blue
FlavorText: A pattern born from waveform flux in the probability kilns of the City.

Name: Queen's Arrow
FlavorText: City artists created this pattern to honor the Queen of the Awoken.

Name: Racer's Scarf
FlavorText: All your rivals will see are your contrails in the distance.

Name: Red Eclipse Cloak
FlavorText: Still we shine.

Name: Rihla Mantle
FlavorText: The City is hungry for tales of your exploits.

Name: Rustworn Cloak
FlavorText: It's been stained and torn by old metal. But whatever it went through, it survived.

Name: Shattered Vault Cloak
FlavorText: The machines are not invincible.

Name: Shroud of Flies
FlavorText: They gather where death steps.

Name: Silent Specter
FlavorText: We linger in the wild, stalking and exploring without a sound.

Name: Solar Flayer Mantle
FlavorText: A mantle of woven Solar energy strings taken from the Psion Flayer Vatch.

Name: Spektar Aspriet Cloak
FlavorText: "Fly high. Strike hard. Repeat." —Ain Suhu-ässä

Name: Spektar Cloak
FlavorText: More than one color stains the battlefield.

Name: Spektar Heliopause Cloak
FlavorText: If only Darkness lies beyond the heliopause, we have already lost.

Name: Spektar Infinite Cloak
FlavorText: …pulled the subject from the Device he appeared frozen. No vitals, but the body hasn't rotted either. —RECORD 340-CHASM-NULL

Name: Spektar Kallipolis Cloak
FlavorText: Not the past, not the future. The present is where we should turn our eyes.

Name: Squid Pro Quo
FlavorText: "Yes, my love for cephalopods is well documented." —Pahanin Errata

Name: Strength of the Pack
FlavorText: A pattern worn by Ana Bray during the fateful battle of the Twilight Gap.

Name: Takanome Ranger's Hood
FlavorText: In the darkest days of the Dark Age, camouflage was our only defense.

Name: The Ishtar Dilemma
FlavorText: Never did answer Sundaresh's question, now did we?

Name: Tracker's Wrap
FlavorText: This cut-down cloak marks the bearer as a rising Hunter, newly reborn and eager to roam.

Name: Trailblazer's Hood
FlavorText: You're the first! At least, the first to live to tell about it.

Name: Unbelievably Old Cloak
FlavorText: Look at all that...character.

Name: Vaquero's Cloak
FlavorText: Never did like being in one place for too long.

Name: Venom of Ikaheka
FlavorText: The sigil of the snake, said to represent the fluid lethality of a true Hunter.

Name: Void Flayer Mantle
FlavorText: A mantle of woven Void energy strings taken from the Psion Flayer Numoc.

Name: Warden's Hood
FlavorText: "I always target Taken Psions first. That way I use one bullet instead of 20." —Cayde-6

Name: Wetwork Cloak
FlavorText: [this passage intentionally redacted]

Name: Wolfswood Cloak
FlavorText: In our darkest hour, nine Iron Wolves emerged from the ruins.

Name: Wolves' Cloak
FlavorText: "Run with me, we've new trails to stalk."

Name: 77 Wizard
FlavorText: The Exo called Gaunt is a gunsmith famous for his Wizards.

Name: Amethyst Reign-99
FlavorText: C'est magnifique!

Name: Andromeda
FlavorText: A Guardian relic named for the princess of the night sky.

Name: Angelic Acid
FlavorText: Cast out the world's demons with this needle-nosed plasma lash.

Name: Ashraven's Flight
FlavorText: An advanced energy weapon, forged in fire by the Lords of the Iron Banner.

Name: Badlands-FR4
FlavorText: Stark red rock. Arid sun. Long shadows. Find your spot.

Name: Bronzed Nox Volo V
FlavorText: A well-balanced Cassoid firearm, earned through glory in the Crucible.

Name: Caldera-FR1
FlavorText: Boiling air. Obscuring steam. Calm nerves.

Name: Dämmerung FR3
FlavorText: Manufactured with foamed spinmetal, the FR3's lightweight build makes it popular in rough terrain.

Name: Dämmerung FR5
FlavorText: The snubfire FR5, built around a nugget of null-mass, offers superb agility and power.

Name: Darkblade's Spite
FlavorText: "In the Hive ways of old he challenged Oryx. He failed." —Eris Morn

Name: Elevating Vision
FlavorText: Find a way to the top.

Name: Eosphoros FR4
FlavorText: Dawn is within our sights.

Name: Exile's Curse
FlavorText: It's a blessing in disguise.

Name: Feral Spark FR6
FlavorText: Foaming at the mouth.

Name: Final Rest II
FlavorText: An advanced energy weapon modified by Dead Orbit's superb technicians and specialists.

Name: Futile Gesture
FlavorText: If you like the weapon, then the name's talking about the enemy. If you don't...

Name: Give/Take Equation
FlavorText: As good as you get. As much as you can. All of the time.

Name: Harrowed Midha's Reckoning
FlavorText: "I see now that everything dies. Even...even memory." —Midha, Consort of Stars

Name: Heath-FR3
FlavorText: Sloping hills. Clawing brambles. Bitter herbs.

Name: Helios FR5
FlavorText: Coiled with fieldweave conductors, the Helios FR5 is portable hellfire.

Name: Hitchhiker FR4
FlavorText: A fusion rifle, modified by Dead Orbit's superb technicians and specialists.

Name: Light of the Abyss
FlavorText: In the dark beyond the Hellmouth there is a terrible need for light.

Name: LIGHT/Beware
FlavorText: More light! More light!

Name: Long Far Gone
FlavorText: But I still remember.

Name: Midha's Reckoning
FlavorText: "I see now that everything dies. Even...even memory." —Midha, Consort of Stars

Name: Murmur
FlavorText: "The Hive have learned our secrets. Take them back with fire AND lightning." -Eris

Name: Murmur
FlavorText: "The Hive have learned our secrets. Take them back with fire AND lightning." -Eris

Name: Nox Acror IV
FlavorText: It is an unbinding, a tearing, a siphoning. That is the power of your hand.

Name: Nox Astur III
FlavorText: Let your mind be fleet and subtle as the night-soaring hawk.

Name: Nox Cantor II
FlavorText: Directed energy weapon with a short charge cycle. The NCII is a multirole design that feeds on hydrogen isotope reactant.

Name: Nox Cantor II
FlavorText: The well-balanced NCIII fusion rifle balances power with ease of manufacture.

Name: Nox Cantor V
FlavorText: The NCV has an augmented firing system, allowing for in-field customization.

Name: Nox Crocia I
FlavorText: For you see beyond the fabric of night.

Name: Nox Fury V
FlavorText: The NFV offers a multirole platform wired for punishment.

Name: Nox Inergia IV
FlavorText: The energies of the universe are eager to heed your call.

Name: Nox Praeli III
FlavorText: All that is dark is not Darkness.

Name: Nox Revus II
FlavorText: Directed energy weapon with a short charge cycle. The NRII uses neodymium discharge clamps for more precise fire.

Name: Omolon Test FR1
FlavorText: Omolon prototype. Use in the Crucible to gather data for Omolon's weapons developers.

Name: Painted Helios FR4
FlavorText: A quick-firing Omolon fusion rifle, earned through glory in the Crucible.

Name: Panta Rhei
FlavorText: Everything flows.

Name: Perun's Fire
FlavorText: An energy weapon forged in fire by the Lords of the Iron Banner.

Name: Plan C
FlavorText: Good fighters have contingency plans. Great fighters don't need them.

Name: PLUG ONE.1
FlavorText: Move with the current.

Name: Pocket Infinity
FlavorText: You cannot shake the feeling that this is less a weapon than a doorway.

Name: Praetorian Foil
FlavorText: Erase the future.

Name: Primed Nox Revus IV
FlavorText: An advanced Cassoid fusion rifle with extended range, earned through glory in the Crucible.

Name: Prism Schism
FlavorText: Just look at all the pretty lights!

Name: Prost FR2
FlavorText: Directed energy weapon with a short charge cycle. The Prost's cut-down projector enables rapid fire.

Name: Prost FR3
FlavorText: Wired for confrontation, the Prost FR3 uses a fast-snap chamber for rapid fire.

Name: Purifier VII
FlavorText: Executor-issued energy weapon for loyal supporters of the New Monarchy.

Name: Queenbreakers' Bow
FlavorText: Despite the Breakers' treachery, Her Majesty still stands.

Name: Servant of Askor
FlavorText: Burn away the ether.

Name: Silvered Eos FR4
FlavorText: A quick-firing Omolon fusion rifle, earned through glory in the Crucible.

Name: SK5 Type-Null
FlavorText: A multirole Vanguard-issue fusion rifle, modified for enhanced performance.

Name: Sleeper Simulant
FlavorText: Subroutine IKELOS: Status=complete. MIDNIGHT EXIGENT: Status=still in progress.

Name: Snakebite Surgeon
FlavorText: The venom numbs the burn.

Name: Solas FR2
FlavorText: Directed energy weapon with a short charge cycle. The lightweight Solas is built for close quarters.

Name: Solas FR5
FlavorText: This FR5 variant contains a hard-wrapped induction system to optimize its charge.

Name: Spindevil 3AA
FlavorText: This crisply accurate fusion rifle pins its performance on a mastercraft field muzzle.

Name: Split Shifter Pro
FlavorText: Combat plasma discharge is no matter for amateurs.

Name: Susanoo
FlavorText: The fearsome storms of today become the healing waters of tomorrow.

Name: Techeun Force
FlavorText: An Awoken gift from the Reef, marked with the Queen's crown.

Name: Techeun Force
FlavorText: An Awoken gift from the Reef, marked with the Queen's crown.

Name: Techeun Force
FlavorText: A Techeun's body shimmers with electronic implants and augments.

Name: Techeun Rage
FlavorText: We honor your sacrifice.

Name: Telesto
FlavorText: Vestiges of the Queen's Harbingers yet linger among Saturn's moons.

Name: Tengoku FR1
FlavorText: Fusion Rifles are directed-energy weapons with a short charge cycle. The FR1 is a common multirole design.

Name: Tengoku FR2
FlavorText: Fusion Rifles are directed-energy weapons with a short charge cycle. The FR2 is a multirole design built to kill swarms of light targets.

Name: Tengoku FR2a
FlavorText: Fusion Rifles are directed-energy weapons with a short charge cycle. The FR2a is a multirole design built to kill swarms of light targets.

Name: That Beautiful Glow
FlavorText: Don't go into the light!

Name: The Calming
FlavorText: An energy weapon named and sanctified by the leaders of the Future War Cult.

Name: The Frenzy
FlavorText: An advanced energy weapon, augmented, named and sanctified by the leaders of the Future War Cult.

Name: The Trolley Problem
FlavorText: Pull the lever. It's the right thing to do.

Name: The Vacancy
FlavorText: An advanced energy weapon, named and sanctified by the leaders of the Future War Cult.

Name: The Vortex
FlavorText: An advanced energy weapon, named and sanctified by the leaders of the Future War Cult.

Name: Thesan FR4
FlavorText: Hasten the dawn with the new Omolon Thesan FR4.

Name: Tundra-FR3
FlavorText: White skies. Unyielding ground. Misted breath. Just one shot.

Name: Vex Mythoclast
FlavorText: ...a causal loop within the weapon's mechanism, suggesting that the firing process somehow binds space and time into…

Name: Amethyst Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who are fond of the Reef.

Name: Blue Spine Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts with a sharp tongue.

Name: Bold Red Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who aren't afraid to make themselves a target.

Name: Brave Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who have been there since the beginning.

Name: Competitive Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who stood with their Guardians as they became champions of the Crucible.

Name: Consensus Shell
FlavorText: Ghosts who give testimony before the City's great Consensus often remake their shells in this traditional form.

Name: Consumed Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who have found a new shape.

Name: Crimson Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who want a little glamour.

Name: Dread Explorer Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who scouted the Dreadnaught and lived to tell the tale.

Name: Foundry Shell
FlavorText: City's artisans welcome the deep memories and painstaking finesse of the Ghosts.

Name: Frontier Shell
FlavorText: Tough, rugged, and defiantly colored - ready to brave the high frontier. Ghosts can self-modify at will.

Name: Generalist Shell
FlavorText: Born from the Traveler, built of machinery and Light, the Ghost is your companion and faithful guide.

Name: Intrusion Shell
FlavorText: Rigged for eavesdropping, surveillance, and intrusion into unfriendly networks. Ghosts can self-modify at will.

Name: Iron Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who are forged in battle.

Name: Ishtar Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who have forged new paths on Venus.

Name: Joyride Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts that like to feel the wind on their casings.

Name: Kingslayer Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who were there when Oryx fell.

Name: Mare Cognitum Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who have forged new paths on the Moon.

Name: Meridian Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who have forged new paths on Mars.

Name: Metropolitan Shell
FlavorText: For a Ghost of the Last City.

Name: Pale Dawn Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who trust in the Light.

Name: Purple Spine Shell
FlavorText: For ghosts with a "prickly" personality.

Name: Pursuer Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who are always chasing the next challenge.

Name: Questing Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who love adventure.

Name: Redux Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who favor a new take on a classic look.

Name: Scholar Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who have contributed to the City's knowledge.

Name: Shipwright Shell
FlavorText: Sometimes the best way to troubleshoot a faulty NLS drive is to dive in and get your shell dirty.

Name: Skywatch Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who have forged new paths in the Cosmodrome.

Name: Standard Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who prefer the classics.

Name: Sugary Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who enjoy the sweet taste of Crucible victories.

Name: Sunlit Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who believe.

Name: Turquoise Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts with bright personalities.

Name: Vanguard Shell
FlavorText: This shell marks the Ghost as a trusted instrument of the Guardian Vanguard.

Name: Vanguard Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who have proven themselves as leaders in the field time and time again.

Name: Verdant Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts looking to brighten their Guardian's day.

Name: Weathered Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who have braved the elements.

Name: Winter Sky Shell
FlavorText: For Ghosts who feel blue.

Name: 0A0X Nightmask
FlavorText: Crucible variant. Cut down and regraphed for agility.

Name: Acolyte Rung
FlavorText: "Mota was so close -- clawing her way out with bones torn from the Acolytes. Her fall -- Omnigul. You honor her." - Eris

Name: AOS#Cryptid
FlavorText: Crucible variant. Activated polymer will self-shape to grip your favorite knife.

Name: Argus Deimatic
FlavorText: The coil complex on the left gauntlet may experience alarming mass fluctuations.

Name: Aspriet
FlavorText: Crucible variant. Fieldweave grafted for strong, accurate throws.

Name: Astrolord Grips
FlavorText: Accept war as a fundamental process, not a transient condition.

Name: Battuta
FlavorText: Some of the City's best-selling authors are Hunters-turned-travel writers.

Name: Blindsight Sleeves
FlavorText: "With the sight, I saw the self within the self." —Fractal Scrolls

Name: Bog Wild
FlavorText: Try not to get bogged down with the little things.

Name: Brusilov
FlavorText: One part curiosity, one part obligation, two parts reckless pride.

Name: Carnivore Match
FlavorText: It's all in the execution.

Name: Cold Mantis
FlavorText: "Your job on the fireteam is to answer the question 'Can we kill that thing?' Make sure the answer is always yes."

Name: Corsair's Revenge
FlavorText: "During the Hildian Campaign, modified Fallen armor was more common among the Reef troops than the standard issue."

Name: Cryptid
FlavorText: The lovingly crafted Cryptid family includes a kinematically charged joint massager - on every finger!

Name: Darkhollow Grasps
FlavorText: "All the vastness of our universe is but a blank page on which they scrawl their words of hate and death." —Eris Morn

Name: Dead Light Grips
FlavorText: "At least we'll know we tried." —Arach Henri

Name: Desolate Grips
FlavorText: More than shadows, but less than starstuff.

Name: Dogged Gage
FlavorText: One doesn't need sleeves to keep knives inside them.

Name: Don't Touch Me
FlavorText: Amputated from a creature that stumbled out of a Vex gate. A vestigial defensive reflex still remains.

Name: Dustwalker
FlavorText: Shiftwire can induce nerve activity. It makes mere skin feel like dead plastic.

Name: Elector's Grips
FlavorText: True power comes from the hands of the people.

Name: Exodus Grips
FlavorText: We must make our own safety without the City.

Name: Fear Eater
FlavorText: Stay at the top of the food chain.

Name: Forester
FlavorText: The wilderness reclaimed Earth after the Collapse. Now Hunters reclaim the wilderness.

Name: Ghost Angel
FlavorText: As we climbed the tern cliffs he moved their nests aside, real gently. At the top he strangled the Fallen sentry. Same hands."

Name: Gravebreaker
FlavorText: Careful around the upholstery.

Name: Grips of No Tomorrow
FlavorText: Accept war as a fundamental process, not a transient condition.

Name: H_LD Starwinder
FlavorText: The trigger action is the central action, and so it must feel euphoric.

Name: Harrowed Darkhollow Grasps
FlavorText: "All the vastness of our universe is but a blank page on which they scrawl their words of hate and death." —Eris Morn

Name: Heliopause Grips
FlavorText: "We are not fatalists. We're optimists. We believe life exists beyond this dead orbit." —Arach Linde

Name: Immanent War Grips
FlavorText: Tomorrow will not be easily tamed.

Name: Infinite Lines Grips
FlavorText: "I saw three queens. No, two. No...just one." —RECORD 351-CHASM-6915

Name: Iron Breed Sleeves
FlavorText: Ornate armor forged by the Lords of Iron beneath the Iron Banner.

Name: Iron Camelot Grips
FlavorText: Forged in remembrance of Perun, she who hunted the Darkness where it dwelt.

Name: Iron Companion Sleeves
